content: अधर्मः [न. त.] {@--1@} Unrighteousness, irreligion, impiousness, wickedness, injustice; °दंडनं <ls>Ms. 8. 127</ls> unjust punishment; अधर्मेण unjustly, in an improper way; यश्चाधर्मेण पृच्छति <ls>Ms. 2. 111</ls>; an unjust act; a guilty or wicked deed; sin; °चारिन् committing unjust or unrighteous deeds; so °आत्मन् of an irreligious spirit; तदा कथं °भीरुः <ls>Ś. 5</ls>; °मय full of wickedness or sin; for definitions &c. of धर्म and अधर्म See <ls>Tarka K.</ls> <ab n="Page">P.</ab> 19. (धर्म and अधर्म are two of the 24 qualities mentioned in Nyāya, and they pertain only to the soul. They are the peculiar causes of pleasure and pain respectively. They are imperceptible, but inferred from reasoning and from transmigration.) {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of a Prajāpati or of an attendant of the sun. --र्मा Unrighteousness personified. --र्मं Devoid of attributes, an epithet of ब्रह्मन्.
